intro: Stellarioides albovirens, commonly known as the white-green starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Stellarioides albovirens is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local insect populations.
